q: Vito said Michael Vick is the company's first corporate spokesman. Terms of his deal weren't disclosed. But Vito said it's a "sizable" contract. We believe it was worth it, he said, "because of Michael Vick and how he can shed light on the technology of our products." Unequal Technologies makes several shock-blocking sports pads. . Gartner says Gmail has captured less than 1% of the enterprise e-mail market, counting only businesses with at least 100 paid seats. Managed services partners are jumping on board, though. A growing number of MSPs have embraced the Google Apps Reseller program, says an MSPmentor says Eric Schmidt 's Google has gained "more channel partner momentum with managed services providers. Indeed, 29 of the world's top 100 MSPs now promote Google Apps to their end-customers."

Football fans cheer for hard hits all the time, and if the Bears were facing the Eagles, virtually every Bears fan would have joined Buehrle in hoping that Michael Vick got viciously hit. As James Harrison said, I don't want to injure anybody... I try to hurt people. In football, football fans root for players to get hurt. Football players try to inflict hurt. I'd find it easier to censure Buehrle if football's hypocrisy on pain weren't so transparent. Report

Egypt, added the statement, recognized and appreciated the care accorded by Germany to the painted limestone bust of the famous ancient Egyptian queen, but added: Egypt is confident that the German authorities will assist in facilitating its return. The government and people of Egypt are eager that this unique treasure be returned to the possession of its rightful owners, the Egyptian people. If returned, Zahi Hawass said, the bust will be exhibited at a new museum south of Cairo. Egypt's top archaeologist has formally requested the return of the 3,300-year-old bust of Queen Nefertiti that has been

the quarterback shouldn't qualify as a dog owner. But Best Friends also has conceded that Michael Vick has put a brighter spotlight on the problem of dogfighting and the rehabilitation of pit bulls than they ever imagined possible. I'd have to say that he brought attention to the issue in a rather unfortunate way, said Best Friends co-founder Francis Battista. "It's like people dying in a burning building.
